GameData.Language_en_US:
Drought
Drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms produce -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
Severe Drought
Severe drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms and Pastures containing Sheep and Cattle produce -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
Critical Drought
Critical drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms produce -2 [ICON_FOOD] Food and Pastures containing Sheep and Cattle produce -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
Up in Flames
Due to the overly dry conditions, wildfires have broken out in the forest around the City. The resulting damage results in losses amounting to -1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production over the next {5_Turns} for every forest worked by the City.
Exposure
Sub-zero temperatures have left many people in the City at risk to exposure resulting a loss of 1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the City.
Fuel Shortage
Due to extreme cold, the City is currently experiencing a major fuel shortage. {1_YieldCost} has been diverted from our industries to compensate provide heat to the citizens.
Frozen Waters
The city's river has frozen over, severely hampering commerce. Our Economic Advisor said that we can expect City tax revenues to drop by {3_CityYield} for {5_Turns}.
Bitter Winds
Bitterly cold winds are severely hampering production in the lands around the City. For {5_Turns}, all Quarries, Pastures, Farms, and Lumbermills produce -1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Bumper Crop
Farmers near the City report that the rainy weather has greatly benefited them, and that they are expecting much larger crop yields than normal. You can likely expect an additional {2_InstantYield} from this harvest.
Desert in Bloom
Steady rains have given the once barren desert new life. Desert tiles without water can now grow +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food until the rains stop.
Good Harvest
This favorable drizzly weather around the City has been very good for our local Farms and Plantations. They are anticipating a +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food increase for the next {5_Turns}.
Farms Underwater
The never-ending rains have caused the City's rivers to rise above flood levels. Nearby Farms are suffering -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food production losses, and our Science Advisor is suggesting it may last up to {5_Turns}.
Crop Blight
All this rain and damp is not good at all for crops. The City governor is now hearing reports of crops rotting in the fields before they can be harvested. Damages are estimated to result in -1 [ICON_FOOD] in all the City's Farms until things can dry out. Our weather advisors forecast things should begin to dry up within {5_Turns}.
Mudslides Hinder Trade
The slopes of the City's nearby mountains are inundated with water, and mudslides are becoming a hazard to travelers. Between road repairs and lost commerce taxes, our City treasury will likely drop by {3_CityYield} for {5_Turns}.
Massive Flooding!
As a result of the heavy rainfall, water is pouring over the river's banks and flooding into the streets. Lack of investment in flood protection around the City has only made matters worse. We can expect some significant infrastructure damage to City buildings and figure on some prime farmland being destroyed with an overall effect that we should expect -2 [ICON_FOOD] Food at nearby Farms for the next {5_Turns}.
Bad Water = Bad Farms
With the lack of regulation, industry seems to be thriving in the City. Granted, the water seems to be a strange color and has a certain funny smell. Our Science advisor tells us this is the reason that nearby Farms are suffering -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food loss.
Clean Air, Part Une
Thanks to the new regulations, our City's industries were able to clean up their act. After spending {1_YieldCost} to repair the environmental damage, local Farms have recovered from their -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food loss.
Mercury on Marigolds and Arsenic on Mittens
Is this really progress? Our water taste vile...our air is foul... The insects have disappeared. You rarely ever see any birds or furry animals. And, after seeing another-1 [ICON_FOOD] Food loss, our local Farms are less and less productive.
Clean Air, Part Deux
Thanks to the new regulations, our City's industries were able to clean up their act. After spending {1_YieldCost} to repair the environmental damage, local Farms have recovered from their -2 [ICON_FOOD] Food loss.
Bad Actor
In spite of the new environmental regulations, you just discovered a local industry has continued to dump waste into their nearby waterway. It looks like the City's Farms will be impacted with -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food production for {5_Turns}. You have to spend {2_InstantYield} to repair the damage.
Plague!
Our worst fears have come true. Plague has reached the City! People lie dead in the streets, and hundreds more die every day. Our doctors report that 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen communities have already died in the City.
Eruption!
Oh no! A once-dormant mountain near the City has suddenly erupted, pouring down lava into the City and the surrounding countryside! The City has lost 3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population, multiple Improvements are damaged, and many City buildings are destroyed!
Krakatoa Erupts!
Krakatoa has erupted! Massive plumes of ash, smoke, and lava have enveloped the nearby City and its countryside. The City has lost 3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population, multiple Improvements are damaged, and many City buildings are destroyed!
Earthquake!
Oh no! There was a minor earthquake near the City. Several Improvements are damaged, and some City buildings are destroyed!
A Major Earthquake!
A massive earthquake has struck the City causing widespread death and major damage all across the area. The City has lost 3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population, multiple Improvements are damaged, and many City buildings are destroyed!
Avalanche
Snow melt from a nearby mountain has collapsed, causing a massive avalanche. You should probably expect some Improvements to need repair.
Up in Flames
Due to the overly dry conditions, wildfires have broken out in the forest around the City. The resulting damage results in losses amounting to -1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production over the next {5_Turns} for every forest worked by the City.
Life Finds a Way
While the forest fires were devestating around the City, they did reinvigorate the local flora. The resulting growth results +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food over the next {5_Turns} for every forest worked by the City.
Mrs. O'Leary's Cow
A major fire has broken out in the City! We must contain it, or it could destroy everything? What do you want us to do?
Our people are our most valuable resource. Tell everyone to get out of there as quickly as possible!
With no one to fight the fire, there is a good chance we may lose a number of buildings. But, more importantly, our citizens know that you are prioritizing them over infrastructure.
Get the citizen's to form a temporary fire brigade. We must save the City, no matter the cost!
Calling upon the citizenry should greatly reduce the damage to the City. Hopefully, no one gets hurt too badly in the process.
Fire Stopped in {3_CityName}.
A fire broke out in {3_CityName}, but citizens were able to use the river to save the city.
Fire Brigades and Building Codes
As our history has shown, fire is one of the most destructive elements of nature. Concerned citizens have come forward asking to establish a permanent fire brigade. They are also hoping to adopt some new building codes to prevent our City from burning down around us? What would you like us to do with this petition?
I think it's a splendid idea! Provide them with the requested funding.
Allocate {2_InstantYield} in spending to fund the brigade and bring our public buildings up to this new code.
Fires are so rare, and our budgets are already stretch too thin. Maybe we can do this when the economy is doing better.
Nothing happens.
Nuclear meltdown!
The worst has happened. The City's Nuclear Plant has had a meltdown, rendering vast sections of the city uninhabitable. The building is destroyed, and all other buildings in the City are at risk. The City loses 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
Major hurricane approaches
A major hurricane looms on the horizon, and is headed straight for the City. It may or may not hit the city. If we do nothing and it hits, we can expect major losses of life and property. The City's council is unsure of how to respond, and looks to you for guidance.
Send in the military to start putting down sandbags and boarding windows.
The disruption costs {1_YieldCost}. If the hurricane hits, expect large losses of life.
Send in the military to evacuate the City.
The evacuation costs {1_YieldCost}. If the hurricane hits, expect major property damage.
Evacuate the City and sandbag everything.
These efforts will take {1_YieldCost}. The City is well-prepared for the hurricane.
Buckle down and hope for the best. There's nothing we can do.
No preparation. Good luck!
Our river's levee should protect us from storm.
Rely on the City's hurricane levee. If the levee system is breached, expect some loss of life and property damage.

Hurricane Levee System
Concerned citizens have come forward asking us to build a levee to protect from hurricanes. Our engineers are telling us a proper levee system could protect the City from minor hurricanes and reduce the damage from major hurricanes. What would you like us to do with this petition?
I think it's a splendid idea! Provide them with the requested funding.
Allocate {1_YieldCost} in spending to fund the new levee system.
Hurricanes are so rare, and our budgets are already stretch too thin. Maybe we can do this when the economy is doing better.
Hurricane Levee System
This hurricane levee system will protect the City from minor hurricanes and may protect the City from major hurricanes.
